p.s: In this excerpt Gatsby wants to revive a past relationship with Daisy.
I think the chances of this happening are pretty high.
I think this because Gatsby is after five long years still attracted to Daisy and will do everything, that is necessary to win her back.
He also has Nick as some sort of a wingman, which helps much.
That is because Daisy and Nick are cousins and she likes Nick very much.
The major problem here is, that Daisy is married to Tom Buchanan.
Tom has an affair with Myrtle Wilson, who lives in the valley of ashes, and has some other affairs too.
Also Daisy is not happy with Tom as her husband because of that and the fact, that she really loves Jay Gatsby.
Those are the reasons, why I think, that the chances of the revival of Daisy's and Gatsby's relationship are pretty high.
In my opinion it always depends on the two persons involved.
If the one person hates the other one, the chances of such a relationship are very low.
It could also be, that one of the two involved is married and happy with the marriage.
In this case the chances are pretty low too.
All in all it depends on the two persons involved in the possible relationship.
